types.helpText: Tables available to store instance data. Each table stores a collection of records. Each row corresponds to a single record, and each column corresponds to a field. Applications use tables and records to manage data and processes.
types.name: Table

types.helpText: Controls to specify the properties of database tables and columns such as data type, length, and default value
types.name: Table Column

types.helpText: Many-to-many relationship between two tables for allowing one table to be a related list of another
types.name: Many to Many Definition

types.helpText: Controls to create a relationship between two data tables, which are required to display related lists
types.name: Relationship

types.helpText: Controls to specify what fields to show on a form for a particular view or user
types.name: Form

types.helpText: Controls to specify what columns to show on a list for a particular view or user
types.name: List Layout

types.helpText: Controls to specify which list features are available such as displaying the New and Edit buttons
types.name: List Control

types.helpText:
Related lists display records in another table that have
        a relationship to the current record. Users can view and modify
        information in related lists using standard list controls.
types.name: Related List

types.helpText: Controls to specify the CSS styling of a particular field
types.name: Style

types.helpText: Controls to create a custom link in a list or form's contextual menu to perform a particular action
types.name: Context Menu

types.helpText: Controls to automatically set the Form View based on record field values
types.name: View Rule

types.helpText: Custom Jelly-based HTML pages available to the system
types.name: UI Page

types.helpText: Script-based controls for generating calendars and timelines
types.name: Schedule Page

types.helpText: Record changes that occur between two predefined dates
types.name: Timeline Page

types.helpText: Geographical maps to associate with records in the database
types.name: Map Page

types.helpText: Controls to pre-populate particular forms with record data
types.name: Template

types.helpText: Custom Jelly-based user interface elements available for lists, forms, and pages
types.name: UI Macro

types.helpText: Controls to specify what custom user interface to display on a particular form
types.name: UI Formatter

types.helpText: Provides targeted help content to a user in a UI page, based on their role. Embedded Help Content appears in the right sidebar when the user clicks the help icon.
types.name: Embedded Help

types.helpText: Provides a way to demonstrate to users how to use a feature or perform a task in the platform. You create a set of tour steps with callouts that point to appropriate UI elements, and provide the description or instruction to proceed. You select a specific event as a trigger in each step to advance to the next step.
types.name: Guided Tour

types.helpText: Business logic to execute in response to an operation against a particular database record.  These business rules may take declarative actions or include arbitrary scripting.
types.name: Business Rule

types.helpText: Server-side JavaScript classes available to the system
types.name: Script Include

types.helpText: Controls to create a custom button or link on lists or forms to perform a particular action
types.name: UI Action

types.helpText: Rules to enforce data integrity and policy
types.name: Data Policy

types.helpText: HTTP endpoints available to perform arbitrary scripting actions
types.name: Processor

types.helpText: Scripts available to the system to run on a schedule without needing a user transaction
types.name: Scheduled Script Execution

types.helpText: Controls for registering events and associating them with a table
types.name: Event Registration

types.helpText: Custom scripts to run when the system receives a registered system event
types.name: Script Action

types.helpText: Scripts to fix data, schema, or settings during an upgrade
types.name: Fix Script

types.helpText: Client-side JavaScript for running business logic on forms when certain browser events occur
types.name: Client Script

types.helpText: Controls to specify what fields are visible and editable on a form based on its current content
types.name: UI Policy

types.helpText:
UI scripts provide a way to package client-side
        JavaScript into a reusable form, similar to how script includes
        store server-side JavaScript. Administrators can create UI scripts and run them
        from client scripts and other client-side script objects and from HTML code.
types.name: UI Script

types.helpText: Rules for assigning incidents based on certain value combinations
types.name: Assignment Data Lookup

types.helpText: Rules for setting incident priority based on certain value combinations
types.name: Priority Data Lookup

types.helpText: Controls for automatically changing records values based on data lookup rules
types.name: Data Lookup Definitions

types.helpText:
Mobile applications are mini applications that are accessible from the ServiceNow app on your mobile device.
        
        These applications will allow you to view and interact with data from ServiceNow.
types.name: Mobile Application

types.helpText: Security tokens to control access to user interface elements such as menus, modules, tables, and fields
types.name: Role

types.helpText: Access controls for restricting access to system objects and operations
types.name: Access Control

types.helpText: Controls for allowing users to view a page without having to log in or pass access controls
types.name: Public Pages

types.helpText: Controls to configure application and instance behaviors
types.name: System Property

types.helpText: Controls for grouping system properties into sections on a page
types.name: System Property Category

types.helpText: Controls to specify what string to display in the user interface for a specific language
types.name: Message

types.helpText: Application menus available for the application navigator
types.name: Application Menu

types.helpText: Links available to display within application menus
types.name: Module

types.helpText: Controls for grouping modules in the application navigator
types.name: Application Menu (Mobile)

types.helpText: Controls for creating links to lists, UI pages, or reports in the application navigator
types.name: Module (Mobile)

types.helpText: Email notifications available to the system
types.name: Notification

types.helpText: Templates for creating email notifications
types.name: Email Template

types.helpText: Controls to specify how the system processes incoming email it receives
types.name: Inbound Email Actions

types.helpText: Configurations to define the look, feel, and behavior of a portal.
types.name: Service Portal

types.helpText: Pages to hold Service Portal content. A page can open in any portal.
types.name: Service Portal Page

types.helpText: Angular components that execute a specified behavior within a Service Portal page.
types.name: Widget

types.helpText: Style sheet associated with a header and footer to define the appearance of a portal.
types.name: Theme

types.helpText: Style sheets that can be added to any Service Portal page or component to overwrite the theme.
types.name: Style Sheet

types.helpText: Client-side JavaScript that can be associated with a widget and used in the widget client controller.
types.name: JS Include

types.helpText: Collection of third-party libraries, JavaScript includes, external style sheets, or angular modules that a widget depends on.
types.name: Widget Dependency

types.helpText: Group of pages that follow a set of consistent design elements such as the Employee Self-Service (ESS) portal
types.name: Site

types.helpText: Collection of links to internal content, attachments, or external URLs
types.name: Content Link

types.helpText: Group of style sheets that define the appearance of a site
types.name: Content Theme

types.helpText: Content blocks for showing the details of a specific record
types.name: Content Block - Detail

types.helpText: Content blocks for Flash movies
types.name: Content Block - Flash

types.helpText: Content blocks for headers
types.name: Content Block - Header

types.helpText: Content blocks for iFrame containers
types.name: Content Block - iFrame

types.helpText: Content blocks for a list of records
types.name: Content Block - List

types.helpText: Content blocks for navigation menu containers
types.name: Content Block - Menu

types.helpText: Content blocks for dynamically-generated script data
types.name: Content Block - Programmatic

types.helpText: Content blocks for static HTML data
types.name: Content Block - Static

types.helpText: Collection of CSS style sheets, organized by theme
types.name: Style Sheet

types.helpText: Pages available to create CMS sites
types.name: Portal Page

types.helpText: Image files available to the system
types.name: Images

types.helpText: Video files available to the system
types.name: Video

types.helpText: Catalog items available to the Service Catalog
types.name: Catalog Item

types.helpText: Catalog Items to create Task records from the Service Catalog
types.name: Record Producer

types.helpText: Items and services end users can order from a catalog
types.name: Catalog

types.helpText: Categories to organize Service Catalog Items
types.name: Category

types.helpText: Fields to display when viewing Catalog Tasks, Catalog Items, and Requested Item Tasks
types.name: Catalog UI Policy

types.helpText: Group of variables shared between catalog items
types.name: Variable Set

types.helpText: Service Catalog items for providing information instead of goods or services
types.name: Content Item

types.helpText: Execution Plans defining how to procure, configure, and install Catalog Items
types.name: Execution Plan

types.helpText: Guides to order multiple related Catalog Items as a single request
types.name: Order Guide

types.helpText: Client-side JavaScript for running business logic on catalog items or variable sets when certain browser events occur
types.name: Catalog Client Scripts

types.helpText: Controls to create, display, and publish reports
types.name: Report

types.helpText: Metric controls for collecting report data
types.name: Metric Definition

types.helpText: Reports to schedule for automatic generation and distribution by email
types.name: Scheduled Email of Report

types.helpText: Controls to define which colors a particular report uses
types.name: Chart Colors

types.helpText: Colors available for reports to use
types.name: Color Definition

types.helpText: Controls to define the label, color, and values included in a report range
types.name: Range

types.helpText: Data sources are used to import data from external sources such as a file, JDBC database, or LDAP directory service
types.name: Data Source

types.helpText: This type of web service will transform the incoming data synchronously based on the associated transform maps by default. Web Service Import Sets complement Direct Web Services and Scripted Web Services in providing a web service interface to Import Set tables.
types.name: Import Set Web Service

types.helpText: Scheduled imports are used to schedule the import of data using data sources and can leverage transform maps
types.name: Scheduled Data Import

types.helpText: Scripted REST APIs are used to create custom inbound REST APIs
types.name: Scripted REST API

types.helpText: Scripted SOAP Web Services are used to create custom inbound SOAP Web Services
types.name: Scripted Web Service

types.helpText: Transform maps are used to transform data from an import set's temporary staging table to a target table
types.name: Table Transform Map

types.helpText: Export Definitions are used to define the data that will be included in an Export Set
types.name: Export Definition

types.helpText: Controls for exporting data to an external source
types.name: Export Set

types.helpText: Export Targets specify the target file on a MID server that Export Set data will be written to
types.name: Export Target

types.helpText: REST messages are used to make outbound HTTP requests to REST APIs
types.name: REST Message

types.helpText: Scheduled Exports are used to specify a schedule when Export Sets will be run. A single export can be scheduled or regular intervals can be scheduled with support for including only delta records
types.name: Scheduled Data Export

types.helpText: SOAP messages are used to make outbound HTTP requests to SOAP Web Services
types.name: SOAP Message

types.helpText: A flow is an automated process consisting of a sequence of actions and a trigger.
types.name: Flow

types.helpText: An action is a reusable operation that enables process analysts to automate Now Platform features without having to write code.
types.name: Action

types.helpText: Credentials and connection information are required to gain access to a computer or network device for Discovery, Service Mapping, and Cloud Management or to perform work using Orchestration.
types.name: Connection & Credential Aliases

types.helpText: Controls for automating multi-step processes with a sequence of activities
types.name: Workflow

types.helpText: Controls to automatically run a workflow on a schedule
types.name: Workflow Schedule

types.helpText: Schedule during which Changes may be performed
types.name: Schedule

types.helpText: Schedule during which Changes are prohibited from being performed
types.name: Blackout Schedule

types.helpText: Schedule during which maintenance may be performed on specific CIs
types.name: Maintenance Schedule

types.helpText: Risk conditions for change requests
types.name: Risk Conditions

types.helpText: Scheduling options for calculating a target time or duration
types.name: Relative Duration

types.helpText: Script Includes available to MID servers
types.name: MID Server Script Include

types.helpText: Script files available to MID Servers
types.name: MID Server Script File

types.helpText: Properties to configure a MID server
types.name: MID Server Property

types.helpText: Functions available to a specific MID server IP address range
types.name: MID Server Capability

types.helpText: Values a MID Server uses to search for similar devices
types.name: MID Server Capability Value Test

Data Items
